summary: Hey guys, so I can’t say for sure how accurate this is, but please try your best to watch Andi Mack on Disney Channel when the...
body: Hey guys, so I can’t say for sure how accurate this is, but please try your best to watch Andi Mack on Disney Channel when the new episodes air!! The views are going down and that might help them to decide whether or not to renew the series for a Season 4. 🙏🏾

summary: now that Cyrus no longer has a crush on Jonah and doesn’t look at him in an idolized way the scenes between them flow way better...
body: now that Cyrus no longer has a crush on Jonah and doesn’t look at him in an idolized way the scenes between them flow way better and are actually enjoyable! They are now able to have “normal” conversations that flow naturally without cyrus just gushing over Jonah and stuttering. I’m really here for platonic Jyr**!

tags: i spent longer than expected on this. hopefully everything is clear! lmk if its not!
summary: Analysis: Why TJ Kippen should be shamelessly gay.
body:
Analysis: Why TJ Kippen should be shamelessly gay.

There’s been quite a bit of talk regarding Tyrus angst; I’ve specifically seen some posts about how TJ, insecure about his (gay) feelings for Cyrus, might lash out and/or ignore Cyrus before they finally get together.

I really hope this type of angst doesn’t happen.

#1 reason why I don’t think TJ should ‘struggle’ with his sexuality: The trope of the mean, angry, closeted/in-denial jock needs to END.

It makes sense that male athletes would struggle with their gayness, seeing how male athletes are often held up as ideals of hegemonic (toxic) masculinity and heteronormativity. But instead of reinforcing this pattern, media portrayals can offer positive alternatives instead.

There are two major examples of the tragically closeted gay football player on North American TV (aimed at teens) from the past decade that I know of: Riley Stavros from Degrassi, and Dave Karofsky from Glee. Both of these characters are closeted gay athletes who have very tragic storylines related to their internalized homophobia and self-hatred. I’ll go into a summary of Riley’s gay storyline below, for context on the issue.

  • Riley is a star athlete, captain and quarterback on the football team. He pressures himself to perform normative masculinity and heterosexuality, trying to be “normal.”
  • He takes steroids, not only to boost his athletic abilities, but also in hopes that it will somehow make him straight.
  • He becomes more and more aggressive, lashing out at others due to his insecurity and self-loathing related to his gay thoughts. Riley distances himself from anything “gay” by retaliating with violence; for example, he punches Sam, an openly gay man that Riley is attracted to. The LGBT student group reaches out to offer sensitivity training so Riley can unlearn his homophobia, but Riley refers to the LGBT students as “freaks.”
  • Riley desperately searches “how not to be gay” online and pursues conversion therapy, believing he can “cure” this “disease” that he has (that is, until he realizes the therapy is expensive and sounds like a scam).
  • Riley finally admits to himself, and to one friend, that he is gay and that he needs to work on anger management. However, Riley wishes to remain closeted throughout high school, perhaps indefinitely.
  • He eventually gains a love interest, Zane, who is out and proud, but angst continues for a long time. Riley wants to stay closeted and maintain the persona of the “straight football player” at school; Zane receives homophobic harassment from other football players; the two fight over their secret relationship and Riley’s inability to stand up for himself or for Zane; so on and so on. The two have some very sweet moments, but their arc is constantly darkened by the ever-present expectation of homophobic violence against them.

Overall, this is a sympathetic and well-developed portrayal of a gay character; however, the show relies on Gayngst and Armoured Closet Gay tropes. This may have been progressive in 2010, but it’s 2018 now. It’s time to represent some different (more positive!) gay narratives.

Yes, homophobia still exists, and it is still important to show the negative outcomes of homophobia. However, when a tragic gay storyline is the most common (or the only) type of LGBTQ representation that viewers see… It’s very hard to imagine a different, more positive possibility of existence as an LGBTQ person.

The media strongly influences social scripts, norms, and expectations - particularly for relationships, when you’re young and don’t have experience yet! So, it can be hard (as an LGBTQ person) to imagine a positive future for yourself, when all that you see are tragic stories about facing homophobia.

LGBTQ viewers, especially youth, need to see representations of same-gender relationships that are not always defined by cultural baggage.

Instead of struggling with accepting your sexuality, what about the universal struggle of LIKING someone, period? And wondering if they like you back? Being heartbroken if you think it’s unrequited?

The drama between TJ and Cyrus should be because of clueless mutual pining and miscommunication, NOT because of a worn-out trope that would position TJ as self-loathing and violent due to repressed gayness. We’ve already had a dramatic “coming out” portrayal with Cyrus; it would be refreshing to see a contrasting portrayal (ie. TJ isn’t ashamed of being gay or afraid to come out). This brings me to…

Reason #2: it makes sense for TJ’s character.

TJ might have some turmoil about being gay, but it seems pretty clear that he cares deeply for Cyrus and wants to be with him. And a hen TJ wants something, he goes after it.

He may get a little tangled up in insecurity and worries about social judgement, such as with his dyscalculia. But once he realizes that admitting dyscalculia will get him back on the team, he DOES it. He “doesn’t let anybody stand in his way” (as he advises to Cyrus in the muffin scene).

So yes, TJ was worried about what people might think of him with his dyscalculia due to social stigmas, but after Cyrus comforts him, he quickly weighed his options and decided that playing basketball was most important; screw what anyone else might think if they found out about his dyscalculia. Cyrus gives him confidence when he says “nothings wrong with you” and TJ seems to take that to heart.

So, once he realizes he has a chance with Cyrus, romantically, I think he would be the kind of person to GO for it.

I think the angst should come from TJ being unsure if Cyrus would reciprocate those feelings. I’m sure TJ doesn’t want to jeopardize their friendship, but he is clearly smitten… I firmly believe that he has an instant crush from their first meeting, and he was definitely going out of his way to talk to Cyrus in the swing scene (it’s been said a million times but bears repeating: “you come here a lot?” was phrased like a pickup line).

This is just my perspective on the topic, influences by my research on LGBT rep on TV. I don’t know where Terri wants to take them and how much Disney is going to allow. Regardless of how it all turns out, it’s still a big step forward to have a gay storyline, especially a gay romance, on a Disney show. I just hope that it’s handled with care and consideration.

TL;DR: The way I see TJ’s character, he would have a decent amount of anxiety about coming out, and he might get defensive if he felt he was being attacked for his sexuality. But, I don’t think he would have an extremely strong sense of shame* about it that would cause him to revert to the Mean Jock he was when we first met him. I sincerely hope that Disney doesn’t continue the trope of Mean Gay Athlete with Internalized Homophobia.

*I think most of us LGBTQ folks internalize some shame from growing up under cisheteronormativity. When I say “extremely strong shame,” I’m referring to instances such as previously described with Riley: shame so strong that it leads to aggressive denial, excessive violence, attempts at conversion therapy, suicide, etc.

I’m sure TJ doesn’t want to jeopardize their friendship, but he is clearly smitten… I firmly believe that he has an instant crush from their first meeting, and he was definitely going out of his way to talk to Cyrus in the swing scene (it’s been said a million times but bears repeating: “you come here a lot?” was phrased like a pickup line).

This is just my perspective on the topic, influences by my research on LGBT rep on TV. I don’t know where Terri wants to take them and how much Disney is going to allow. Regardless of how it all turns out, it’s still a big step forward to have a gay storyline, especially a gay romance, on a Disney show. I just hope that it’s handled with care and consideration.

TL;DR: The way I see TJ’s character, he would have a decent amount of anxiety about coming out, and he might get defensive if he felt he was being attacked for his sexuality. But, I don’t think he would have an extremely strong sense of shame* about it that would cause him to revert to the Mean Jock he was when we first met him. I sincerely hope that Disney doesn’t continue the trope of Mean Gay Athlete with Internalized Homophobia.

*I think most of us LGBTQ folks internalize some shame from growing up under cisheteronormativity. When I say “extremely strong shame,” I’m referring to instances such as previously described with Riley: shame so strong that it leads to aggressive denial, excessive violence, attempts at conversion therapy, suicide, etc.

summary: #31DaysOfAndiMack Day 16
body:
#31DaysOfAndiMack Day 16

Prompt: If the characters were youtubers who would they be and why?

Andi Mack:

Andi would definitely be an arts and crafts/ diy YouTuber. Kindof like Laura diy. Andi would also do videos educating people on the special Asian holidays and how to celebrate them properly.

Buffy:

I think Buffy would be a vlogger. She vlog her friends antics and give a ton of access for people to get to know the rest of the members on buffys girls basketball team.

Cyrus goodman:

Cyrus would be a lifestyle vlogger as well but he would be known for two types of videos. One of those would be his advice videos. He would ask his viewers to send him questions on how to deal with issues in their own lives. His fans would also love videos where Cyrus aims to cross an item on his “list”.

Jonah Beck:

Jonah would a musician youtuber. He would do covers and music videos that he would have the other help him with. He would also vlog his ultimate games and practices. One of his most emotional videos is him coming clean about his panic attacks.

Tj Kippen:

Tj would use his channel to do several things. He would use his channel to teach people how to play basketball. He would have a whole playlist of tutorials that he sometimes get Buffy’s help with. He would have basketball trick shots and he would have harmless prank videos that he pulls on his team and the good hair crew

Walker Brodsky:

If I spelled his last name wrong I’m sorry. Walker would have time lapse videos of him drawing his art from start to finish. He would have the others guest star from time to time. He would do art challenges and and art tutorials as well

Bex Mack

Bex would definitely be a makeup youtuber, Like Michelle Phan. Doing special makeup looks and showing people correctly apply makeup to different types of faces.

blog.description: L./20/female, a Friend in the Friendom. The icon is by @elder-moss 💖 I love Andi Mack, Marvel’s Runaways, Disney’s Zombies, Carmilla Series, Disney’s Descendants, Wynonna​ Earp, The Good Place•••My otp's are Deanoru, Ambi, Wayhaught, Elhani, Eliza x Addison, Hollstein, Malvie, Juffy, Muffy, Gertchase•••I protect all my cinnamon rolls: Karolina Dean, Nicole Haught, Laura Hollis, Evie Grimhilde, Janet (TGP), Andi Mack and Amber Brown😘 Bex and Andi are an adorable mother and daughter💞😊Bowie came back so now I can use this emoji👨‍👩‍👧!

tags: kinda want to talk about this
summary: So there I am watching a new video (more recent one anyways) from one of my favorite youtubers, exposing another youtuber who...
body:
So there I am watching a new video (more recent one anyways) from one of my favorite youtubers, exposing another youtuber who has been pretending to be a minor when he’s actually 23 and there’s even an fb post his father (I think) posted some time ago stating he is in fact 23. Anyways, I notice a certain actress in the comment section of the ig post in question

[zooms in more]

There she is!

Now after learning about the youtuber in question I decided to head on over to his channel to see for myself if he really is only making videos about actual kids, and lo behold

His homepage. The first thing you see when you go to his channel, a video he made about Annie LeBlanc and Asher Angel.

I don’t know what I’m trying to achieve by posting this??? I honestly just wanted to comment on how a few of the actors from Andi Mack are all being given some exposure due to this guy’s weird fixation with kids. I noticed a few of the actors, thought, “Hey, the Andi Mack kids!”, then realized how weird it is he’s discussing kids at his age and in the way he’s talking about them. It’s not a big deal to be a fan of these talented kids and give them some praise and exposure whether you’re an adult or around their age, that’s not what weirds me out about this youtuber.

His videos all feature him reacting to a lot of kids 15 and under, videos of them twerking or doing something inappropriate or kissing each other or him just discussing their relationships. He hasn’t even tried to hide how he low key has a crush on some of the kids he talks about, Loren Gray and Maddie Ziegler in particular.

Idk I just thought it would be fitting to talk about this since the Friendom is no stranger to inappropriate behavior from some adults in the past and unfortunate creepy p*do content that’s slipped into the tag a few times. I’m not saying he’s done anything but him pretending to be way younger than he actually is just so he could make videos talking about his crushes on underage girls, discuss underage kids’ inappropriate videos or their relationships in general, seems that even he knows something is wrong about that. He’s even taken to deleting some comments related to this issue on his videos recently. Don’t know what that says about him, just wanted to get this out there.
